Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Wednesday, February 18, 2026 3:30 PM As our teams continue to dig out from this storm cycle, Main Lodge is expected to remain CLOSED on Thursday, February 19. Lifts out of Eagle and Canyon Lodge are not expected to spin prior to 9:00 AM with 8 lifts total expected tomorrow. Our teams will work tactically on a rolling opening after assessing conditions and performing necessary mitigation work.

The storm has delivered 17 to 24 inches of new snow in the last 24 hours, bringing the storm total to a massive 44 to 63 inches with significantly more expected through Thursday. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and avoid tree wells. If you choose not to ski or ride due to weather and limited operations, please call 800.MAMMOTH or use our Online Cancelation Form to cancel and request a refund.
  
Upcoming Storm Cycle Expectations:  Snowfall is forecast to taper off by the evening of Thursday, February 19, with sunny skies in the forecast this weekend. Please review our updated storm cycle procedure, new this year.   
Conditions: Heavy snowfall at times, strong SW winds, and near zero temps.  
Visibility: Heavy snowfall and gusty winds will contribute to low visibility conditions.  
Lift status: 8 lifts are expected to spin, with rolling openings to Roller Coaster Express (4), Chair 7, Chair 8, Eagle Express (15), Schoolyard Express (17), Chair 20, Chair 21, and the Village Gondola, conditions permitting. Lifts are not expected to operate out of Main Lodge.  
Safety: Deep snow remains a serious factor. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and stay alert for obstacles beneath new snowfall. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Chains or snow tires are currently required. Heavy snowfall today is making roads snowy and icy. High winds may kick up light powder, reducing visibility. Consider taking the free Mountain Shuttle. If driving, please drive with caution and allow extra space. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
Deep Snow Safety: Stay within sight of your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Obstacles may exist beneath new snow, so ski and ride with caution.
On-mountain emergency hotline: 760.934.0611
